meanings.definition: A person who habitually sees or anticipates the worst or is disposed to be gloomy.
meanings.sent1: The pessimist always expects bad things to happen.
meanings.sent2: My friend is a pessimist and often thinks things will go wrong.
meanings.sent3: The pessimist joked that even sunny days would end in rain.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a dark cloud, a pessimist in a world of optimists.
meanings.sent5: The pessimist's shadow seemed to darken every room he entered.

meanings.definition: One who holds a gloomy or negative view of life.
meanings.sent1: Being a pessimist can make everything seem bleak.
meanings.sent2: The pessimist's outlook on life was always dreary.
meanings.sent3: The pessimist grumbled about the silver lining on every cloud.
meanings.sent4: In a garden of roses, the pessimist only saw thorns.
meanings.sent5: The pessimist's words painted the world in shades of gray.
